metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2299 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Versions of the puppetlabs-apache module prior to 1.11.1 and 2.1.0 make itvery easy to accidentally misconfigure TLS trust. If you specify the`ssl_ca` parameter but do not specify the `ssl_certs_dir` parameter, adefault will be provided for the `ssl_certs_dir` that will trustcertificates from any of the system-trusted certificate authorities. Thisdid not affect FreeBSD.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2299` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

puppet-module-puppetlabs-apache - 3.0.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: puppet-module-puppetlabs-apache package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.0-1').
